definition: A substance that increases the rate of a chemical reaction without itself undergoing any permanent chemical change.
The time at which something is most powerful or successful.
Lasting for a very short time, highlighting the transient nature of some phenomena.
The occurrence of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
Actions or activities that are wicked or criminal in nature.
Keeping careful watch for possible danger or difficulties.
Open to more than one interpretation; not having one obvious meaning.
Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.
Something that is based on another source.
The ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
Direct and unreserved in speech; straightforward and sincere.
Too great or extreme to be expressed or described in words.
Expressed clearly; easy to understand.
Annoyingly insensitive or slow to understand.
Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way.
Complaining in a petulant or whining manner.
Not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily.
A person who can endure pain or hardship without showing their feelings or complaining.
Lasting only for a short period of time; impermanent.
Present, appearing, or found everywhere.
Accorded a great deal of respect, especially because of age, wisdom, or character.
Feeling or showing caution about possible dangers or problems.
Having or showing zeal; fervent.
Having an irritatingly strong and unpleasant taste or smell.
